titles.title: Take Up Thy Cross and Follow Me

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: I walked one day along a country road, And there a stranger journeyed, too, Bent low beneath the burden of His load: It was a cross, a cross I knew.

verse.name: c
verse.lines: “Take up thy cross and follow Me,” I hear the blessed Savior call; How can I make a lesser sacrifice, When Jesus gave His all?

verse.name: v2
v3
verse.lines: “Oh, let me bear Thy cross, dear Lord,” I cried, And, lo, a cross for me appeared, The one, forgotten, I had cast aside, The one, so long, that I had feared.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: My cross I’ll carry till the crown appears— The way I journey soon will end— Where God Himself shall wipe away all tears, And friend hold fellowship with friend.
